sentences.en: "You'll find that everybody will try and help their colleague."— 'Yeah. There's a lot of that.'
sentences.cn: “你会发现同事们都会尽力互相帮助。”——“是呀，有很多这样的事。”

sentences.en: a colleague of mine from the bank
a colleague of mine from the office
A colleague urged him to see a psychiatrist, but Faulkner refused.
sentences.cn: 一位同事竭力劝福克纳去看精神病医生，但他拒绝了。

sentences.en: He grimaced and looked narrowly at his colleague.
sentences.cn: 他做了个鬼脸，然后仔细打量着同事。

sentences.en: He had allegedly tried to proposition a colleague.
sentences.cn: 据说他曾试图向一名同事求欢。

sentences.en: He is a colleague of mine.
He is leaving his north London business in the hands of a colleague.
sentences.cn: 他把自己伦敦北部的业务交给一位同事打理。

sentences.en: He was accused of plagiarizing his colleague's results.
sentences.cn: 他被指控剽窃同事的成果。

sentences.en: He was fired from his job after roughing up a colleague.
sentences.cn: 他因为对一位同事动粗而被开除了。

sentences.en: His discovery extinguished the achievements of his colleague.
sentences.cn: 他的发现使他同事的成就黯然失色.

sentences.en: I hesitated, not wanting to tell tales about my colleague.
sentences.cn: 我犹豫了，不想说同事的坏话。

sentences.en: I made sure my colleague was insane.
sentences.cn: 我完全相信我的同行是神智不清了.

sentences.en: She discussed the idea with some of her colleagues.
sentences.cn: 她和几位同事讨论了这个想法。

sentences.en: The constable received a distress call, and saw two youths attacking his colleague.
sentences.cn: 这名警察收到了求救呼叫，看见两个年轻人正在殴打他的同事。

sentences.en: This is my colleague, Mr Arnold Landon.
sentences.cn: 这位是我的同事，阿诺德·兰登先生。

sentences.en: You could defer the matter to your colleague.
sentences.cn: 你可把这件事委托给同事去办.

trans.tran_en: someone you work with – used especially by professional people
